Reviews.Title: “just what you need in a city break hotel”
Reviews.Author: MonaLisa12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel. Its simple and clean. Rooms cleaned and every night but even if we put our towels on the floor they were not changed. But there were soaps and shampoo in the bathroom, a bidé and good shower. We stayed on the 3rd floor with window to the inner courtyard so it wasn't very noisy, but as I am a light sleeper I always bring earplugs. Our travel companions stayed on the 2nd floor with window to the street and found it very noisy. Breakfast was fine: toasts, yoghurts, juices, good coffee (we asked the very nice breakfast-lady to make us caffe-latte in the kitchen) and sweets. The only thing I missed was some fresh fruit. All reception-staff friendly. The only thing I didn't like was the headboard, old-fashioned covered in fabric. Find it a bit unhygienic.. And for staying in central Rome you pay more for this hotel than a similar further from city center.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and value for your money”
Reviews.Author: tipperary2
Reviews.Content: I have visited the Eternal city over a dozen times in the last ten years and came across this hotel for this trip. perfect,especially if u realise all hotel rooms in Rome are boxs and only used as a base to stop off or sleep. EASILY the best value (and shower) we have stayed in for the price, cleanleness,helpfulness and location. Our new base from mow on.

Reviews.Title: “cute, convenient & cost effective”
Reviews.Author: bibibo_78
Reviews.Content: Staff was really willing to help us, especially the receptionist called Fabio gave us really accurate information about the district, the distances and the right places to visit and to eat, in reasonable prices (2 meal course with bottle of wine and dessert about 40 euro). Rooms were cleaned every day and the roof garden of the hotel where we enjoyed our breakfast was homely but small. The breakfast was adequate with emphasis on sweet goodies and although the capuccino coffee was from a machine it was tasteful. The hotel was about 100 m from cavour metro station on foot, nearby via nazionale (shopping street), mini markets and cosy trattorias & pizzerias. Althought we stayed on the 5th floor the noise was loud, I suggest to ask for a room on the side of via urbana. Also in the bathroom there wasn't a bath baterry ("phone" ) and the water hit directly our head,and it wasn't convenient at all for women hygiene. Overall, we were satisfied by the service, quality and price, and therefore we strongly recommend this place for staying.

Reviews.Title: “Not far from Metro and Train Station, but far from main tourist attraction.”
Reviews.Author: Sam-indonesia
Reviews.Content: I stay here for 3 nights. The hotel 5 to 6 blocks from train station. 200 to 300m from Metro. Nearby have resto (italian n chinese), cafe, minimart. The hotel room is ok. Have wifi, but signal is weak. We stay at 1fl, hv to stand at the door to get signal. Breakfast at 5th floor. It is such a beautiful setup at rooftop. The hotel is far from major tourist spot, have to take metro or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms average, but ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: MarkusF
Reviews.Content: We stayed two first nights in Italy here. Definetely not a disappointed, but not a good surprise. Average. Location is fine, breakfast served in roof-top terrace was located nicely, but the breakfast itself was a really average.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: CaptAction
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canova staff was very friendly and helpful, rooms were small but very comfortable. The small elevator was a source of constant amusement for my teenage daughters, as it will only accommodate two smallish people. Breakfast is adequate, Continental, without eggs, croissants and typically only one sort of ham and cheese. Loads of sweets and cookies. Coffee is ok. Hotel Canova is located on a quiet street (Urbana) a short walk from the Colosseum and the Roma Form. Recommend a ROMA PASS as there is a Metro station at the end Via Urbana, makes it easy to access the rest of Rome. Hotel Canova was very charming and quiet, we really enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: AGaussie
Reviews.Content: The staff were great to us and the location was fab. Particularly just up the road there was the best restaurant we've been to. The rooms were very comfortable! Only the lift was so tiny that it was quite an adventure getting in and out of it with bags!! :)

Reviews.Title: “QUERKY, QUIET, CLEAN AND CLOSE TO CENTRE”
Reviews.Author: BEEGEE77
Reviews.Content: Friendly, articulate reception staff. Room very small and basic with characteristically dark old furniture. Bed comfortable. Bathroom with small shower cubicle. Loved the thick towels. Terracota tiled floors in bedroom - good when hot but not so good when cold. Air conditioning and heating appeared to be centrally controlled despite a notice advising visitors to push the card into the slot and wait for 15 minutes for the air conditioning to kick in. When I enquired about this at reception I was informed that they hadn't switched it on. I gave up in the end and just opened the window. Rooms in public and private areas very clean. Buffet breakfast choice adequate but no hot dishes available. Breakfast room is interestingly querky - alcoves, walls painted like frescoes ... Hotel in quiet side street close to metro, terminii and centre - nearest to Forum and Colloseum, Hotel near to several restaurants and cafes serving good quality food at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Average plus - especially for big city; Breakfast good, room clean”
Reviews.Author: zeckster
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly. The location was a bit farther from the train / metro stations than preferred. The bus lines are pretty close and make up for this. The room we were given was very clean and nicely decorated. The shower did not drain very well and there was an ongoing issue with plumbing as the bathroom contained a drain in the center of the floor where typically no water should be. It is an older building so we could contantly hear water going through drain pipes. You may want to monitor the contruction going on across the street. It made for a really noisy breakfast one morning of the three days we were there. These are fair trade-offs for a less expensive stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff and Clean”
Reviews.Author: blackpearl1234
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel, based on the Trip Advisor recommendations. It was "Perfect" for us. Close to the train station, metro, many shops and restaurants. Everything was within walking distance including the Coleseum and Forum. The staff helped with directions and restaurant suggestions. We ate in different restaurants each night all a short walk from the hotel. We had a small room with balcony facing a fairly quite street and a large bathroom with shower. This is just a block from Via Cavior, a very busy street and Maria Maggiore Church a Hop-on-Hop off bus stop. I would recommend this hotel and hope to stay there in the future. We were two middle/elderly ladies and found this to be a great little hotel. We opted for breakfast on the terrace and it was a great way to start our busy days. Front desk staff were extremely helpful. We visited in mid September 2010. My third trip to Rome and one of the best hotel stays I have experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, service and quiet area, just a little further out from city center”
Reviews.Author: vicky_lb1
Reviews.Content: Rome was the first stop of our Italy vacation and Hotel Canova set high standards for our hotel expecations! The customer service was amazing, and I've stayed in many 4-5 star resorts and they were good. Magdelena at the front answered any questions we asked from diing recommendations to questions about Italy. The rooms were very clean but most importantly, the air conditioner worked and was AMAZING. Especially important after trekking throughout Rome all day. The breakfast that came with the room was served on a very cute, clean terrace and the breakfast spread was nice. Simple, yet they took pride in the food put out and were so nice. Our only complaint was that although advertised as by the Collosseum, it was a little further away. To get to any nightlife ie: Pantheon, woudl either have to take a cab or bus. Either way, Metro system and bus system was easy enough to use and understand so wasn't too much of a problem. Also, not many good restaurants within short walking distance (Within a 2 block radius) Really good for people who don't want to sacrifice clean room and good air conditioning for location.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: geaus
Reviews.Content: The good: the staff were very helpful, giving us maps, helping us book tickets to sights etc. The room was big enough and clean. The location was great -it was within walking distance to everything, but it was still on a relatively quiet street, so sleeping wasn't a problem. Breakfast was included in our stay, which consisted of cold meats, cheese, pastries, bread, cereal, fruit, yoghurt, coffee and juice. The bad: the shower's water pressure was terrible. Overall I would recommend the hotel though, and would stay here again myself.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Homebase for Visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: seek4fun
Reviews.Content: This cool little hotel knows it's place; it's sign outside has three stars on it along with it's name. They don't offer you elegant staircases, or luxurious suites, but they certainly do deliver with what they have. You feel welcome as soon as you walk through the front door into the small, but cosy lobby. A very friendly gentleman greeted and assisted us the moment we entered (we spoke with the desk people from all three shifts and all spoke English and were very pleasant ) I have never seen an elevator this small before (my wife rode up with our luggage while I climbed up the stairs) but it operated fairly quickly. We stayed in two different rooms on different nights and although they were not very big, both were top notch; nicely decorated with super bathrooms (recently renovated with new everything including a bidet and a shower with a glass door), a hutch for your clothes (has a safe inside), a flat sceen TV (all stations in Italian, however), window(s) that open, two suitcase stands, large mirrors on the wall, a small chair, and all super clean (all the floors are tiled) One night we got a pizza from down the street and went up to the hotel rooftop (tiled floor with plants and outdoor tables and chairs) for our supper. The location for this hotel couldn't be better. It's on a quieter side street just parallel to a larger, busier street with all of it's options. It seemed like a safe area to us, even when returning in the dark. It is a pleasant 10 minute walk (with sidewalks) to Termini Station (I timed it), and has all of Rome's attractions nearby. My wife and I like to walk, and we could easily get to most everything including the Colosseum and Vatican City on foot. Buses and subway are close if needed. There's also a small grocery store (where the locals go) just a block down the street. This hotel offers a breakfast from 7 AM in a lovely room (we left early both days that we were there so we missed the breakie, however, on one day, at about 6:45 AM, the clerk opened the room for us and let us help ourselves before we left) We booked this hotel on the internet and paid 50 euros for the first night (in Feb) and then 75 euros for the second night (in Mar) My wife and I LOVE visiting Rome, and from now on, we'll know exactly where we'll be staying!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value,great location,helpful personal”
Reviews.Author: travelingbyrd
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with good location to sites and train/metro station. The room was very good, small but this is normal for Europe (if you want a larger room you'll pay more) at a good price. It has several LOCAL Restaurants close by. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: C4clev
Reviews.Content: The room was not ready when we got there (well after check in) and they asked us to leave our luggage in the lobby and come back in 45 minutes. WE WERE EXAUHSTED...and not to mention the pick up they scheduled for us at the airport never showed. They insist the guy was waiting for us there but we spend a good hour in the airport looking for our pick up. The room is pretty small, not bad, great location and pretty much everyone speaks English, French or Spanish. The air didnt work the first night and it just so happened to be that it was 35 degrees celsius (95 F?) so it was UNBAREABLE! All in all, it was somewhere to rest our head, breakfast was great and on the balcony which was awesome and they were all friendly and very helpful. For what its worth I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best alternative, I will probably return”
Reviews.Author: LeffeSweden
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the third time at Canova. Excellent positioned near Termini but in quiet surroundings. Rooms have always been basic but clean. I cannot help that I am a bit dissapointed about the breakfast: 1/ Coffeemachine produces weak coffe - all alternatives are well below satisfaction 2/ Yoghurts - great but no plain for a diabetic like me and kept for long in room temperature 3/ Cheese in plastic wrapping - in the land of delicious food Italy (can´t be so difficult to serve a couple of cheese pieces and a knife) Despite the breakfast - I will probably return - bringing my own instant coffee to get a proper start for the day

Reviews.Title: “SMALL HOTEL IN GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: joergbobsin
Reviews.Content: Nice, small Hotel in a relatively quiet off-street. 5 Minutes walk from main station Termini and/or subway station Cavour. But beware of the old streets which will ruin ladies' shoes and/or the wheels of your luggage! I urgently recommend a taxi for about 8 Euro! - Receptionists very friendly and helpful. City map of Rome available for free. Elevator very small, nearly fits two people with luggage! Rooms are clean and have a Bidet (!) in the Bathroom but no Kleenex! Beds comfortable. TV is tiny but features CNN in good quality. No Internet access in rooms or Lobby, but two Internet Cafés in waklking distance. (1 Euro per hour). Try to get a room facing the back of the Hotel, however it is close to the balconies of private people in the near apartments, thus you may hear children crying and music - but in any case better than the traffic noise in rooms facing Via Urbana. Positive: Built-in safe in the quite small cabinet! Negative: Doors of cabinet, bathroom etc. squeaking like in a haunted castle but we did not see any ghost. Breakfast served in a nice room with an impressive painting of the Vesuvio eruption Cereals, ham, cheese, biscuits. No fresh fruits or eggs but still better than in similar Hotels I stayed in.... Great Espresso, coffee, Capuccino! No Smoking recommended in the entire Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'm in Rome!!!”
Reviews.Author: carolStockport
Reviews.Content: I think where ever we stayed I wouldn't have minded because I was back in Rome! The Hotel was adequate for our 4 night stay. The roof terrace was closed for breakfast which was a disappointment, and the room was the tiniest room we had ever stayed in, but my boyfriend and I agreed the 3 main things in the room for us were.. a great bed very comfortable, a great shower and a great working air con system. Would we stay here again ... probably not , because we found it was a bit far out to the trevii fountain area for us each day, I would probably pick somewhere nearer there next time worth the extra money!. But overall a good stay and the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel grows on you.”
Reviews.Author: wearb
Reviews.Content: On first impressions this hotel and location is a little off-putting. This impression doesn't last very long. As soon as you get your bearings, you very soon realize how well located this property is. The via Urbana (street that hotel is on) leads down to some nice restaurants and also an Irish pub. In the other direction it leads to the Termini station where you can get the bus or metro. An all day multi use ticket costs just 4 Euro. In yet another direction is the Piazza Republica. So as you can see the location is good. The hotel itself is small with a lift that accommodates two people. The rooms are small but big enough and I believe that by Roman standards they are of an average size. Staff are very helpful and gave us lots of helpful tips. There was also nice coffee/tea, juice, cereal, bread, meat and cheese breakfast. The bread was very tasty. The breakfast room is nice and bright and is on the roof of the building with a covered and open air area. There is a very small bar which I used while waiting in the lobby for the rest of our group to come down and it was adequate for this. Staff speak very good English. There is also somebody at the desk day and night. An encouraging observation was when two well dressed men came in and went straight for the lift, the woman on the reception challenged them to make sure they were staying there. Unless you want to spend a lot more money for some of the other centrally located hotels, I would not hesitate to recommend this one and as I said on the heading this place grows on you.

Reviews.Title: “An average experience”
Reviews.Author: pebe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel three nights in October 2007. The room and the bathroom were very small but clean. The bathroom did not have any hooks for the towels and the toilet seat was loose. In addition the fridge and the safe did not function. The hotel was not able to correct these things during our stay. The breakfast room at the roof terrace was nice, the breakfast, however, was OK but not more than that. The location is good, close to the Santa Maria Maggiore. It is possible that one should not expect the same standards from a 3-star hotel in Rome as elsewhere in Italy. If you can afford it, you should try to find a 4-star hotel instead.

Reviews.Title: “Between Termini and the Colosseum makes this a great citybreak choice”
Reviews.Author: Galeria
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good citybreak choice - based on price and location in Rome, just off the Via Cavour, in a quiet street yet within minutes of the Termini railway station, so no need for taxis...and great for exploring Rome and its art and architectural historic sights, conveniently on-foot. We had sent an email requesting a balcony room but when we arrived we were told that the one balcony room had already been taken but instead we were offered what the receptionist described as the best room in the hotel. Later, we discovered that no rooms have balconies. Given some over reviewers' comments about small rooms, this is something to expect in Rome but we were very satisfied with our first-floor room and can recommend room 101 because it is a suite, with views over the street (yet we had booked only for a double/twin room!) This is ideal if your partner or travelling companion snores, as one of you can sleep on the sofa-bed! Each room also has satellite tv (but not BBC World) so 2 separate televisions can be watched. If we are being hyper-critical, a deserving little moan would be about the shower which was more like a tap...and a rather unpleasant-looking (and too short) shower curtain causing water easily to be sprayed on the floor. The breakfast is quite basic with both coffee and juice-drinks from a machine (not great!) with the main criticism being that breakfast finishes at a rather unnecessarily early 10.30a.m. The bar is a bit-of-a-joke being grossly understocked and with the receptionist doubling as bar staff (valiantly putting on a brave face given the bar's inadequacies)... so don't count on the bar as a great place for ambience and good choices of drinks because it most certainly will fail you. These minor criticisms are more than compensated for by the hotel's good location and we found the staff to be both efficient and friendly. For a choice of restaurants close-by, we'd recommend taking a left turn out of the hotel, and right into Via Panisperna (but avoid at all costs one of the closest: 'La Carbonara' which was our big mistake of our trip, if not the worst we had come across in Italy(!) - but the rest were very good, especially 'Do Do' on the right of Via Serpenti, further on. (Turning left is the Colosseum...) So, on balance we would both recommend this hotel - principally for its location it has to be said - and relaxed, human-scale style - and we'd consider staying again, in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: kenw83
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Canova is a short walk from Termini (the main train station) and 1 block from the main road. It is about a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum and Roman Forum and within walking distance of most other attractions. It is a 5-7 minute walk to the train station where you can take a bus to the Vatican. The rooms are very European (small, not fancy) but very clean. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. We did not try the breakfast, but there is a gelatto place around the corner. The kabobs at the end of the street are fantastic as well. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: eandmottawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Canova for 3 nights as the kickoff of our honeymoon. We loved the hotel. Yes the rooms are small but that is standard across Rome plus we were not there to hang out in the room all day. The room was clean, the staff friendly and the roof top terrace was lovely. The hotel was quiet at night and very secure. We thought the location was great. A nice cafe right on the corner for our morning espresso and pasty. The hotel did offer breakfast and it looked decent however I am Italian and wanted to "do as the Romans do" at the cafe. We walked everywhere and did not require a cab at any time. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Ottawa, Canada

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with the Hotel Canova for value for money!”
Reviews.Author: KylieP
Reviews.Content: After reading the many reviews, I was a little apprehensive about what the Hotel Canova would be like, however I was pleasantly surprised. The gentleman that was on reception in the evening was so friendly and welcoming and extremely likeable. The location was perfect - the main reason being that there is a metro at the end of the road and the many trattorias and restaurants around the area are very reasonable. We had 3 courses most nights for a very good price. We went over to Rome for the marathon and the proximity to Termini/Colosseum etc was ideal. The room was a bit small but I was expecting that but the main thing was, it was clean. Good shower and clean bedding. Breakfast on the roof terrace is basic but does the job. If you are looking for somewhere to rest your head, in a good location with no hassle, then stay at the Canova.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive to what it is..”
Reviews.Author: AAOR
Reviews.Content: The location is not great around even though it is closer to Termini Station rather than the Colisseum. It is very expensive to what it is. Around the area are lots of hotels and the prices a little bit better. I would say it is a 2 stars hotel with A/C. Breakfast definitely not the best. Terrible and cheap ham, if you go to Rome go to a different hotel. I usually follow reviews from tripadvisor, and this hotel was the only bad recommendation, not agree with the others review. Also very unconfortable bed....

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly good!”
Reviews.Author: carla06
Reviews.Content: On first impression we were very dissapointed with our room in Hotel Canova- it was small, pokey,lacked a bathroom window , had no hangers to hang our clothes and the walls were dirty.However as the time passed the friendly staff , wonderful breakfast and good air conditioning made up for this. Also its location is second to none being just a short stroll to the main train station and the collesum . There are a lot of reasonably priced pleasant restaurants in the area and a lovely ice cream shop YuM!

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel in general, but...”
Reviews.Author: Dionisio
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canova is very good in general. Although there are some not so positive points, it wouldn't be fair if I will focus on them alone without emphasizing the positive things that Hotel Canova offers. As with most other hotels, the hotel is in an old traditional but refurbished building. First, it is located in a good location, close to the Termini - around 3-4 minutes walk, but situated in a somewhat quiet neighborhood. Although the idea of staying near the termini sounds off-putting to others, there are actually more advantages. It is also close to major tourist sites (Santa Maria Magiorre, the Colloseum, etc). The staff is friendly and helpful and speaks good English (especially those assigned during the day). Breakfast is included, basic (of course) but nevertheless good and enough. The lady at the breakfast room is consistently friendly with a sweet and happy Bongiorno every morning. Their rooms are clean and the daily housekeeping is very good. The glass panelling on their windows to shut off occasional noises from the street below works. Their lobby is good too. About the negative things that we had experienced during the stay, I have 2 general complaints. Although the hotel was good, I thought they failed to do something on the safety side. They don't have a map of emergency exits inside our room (probably in all rooms) nor did I see any map at least on their hallway (we we're staying on the 5th floor). And even if you can find yourway to the stairs, you may find it somewhat scary as it is narrow and the railings are not in a proper shape (check-out the pictures). Another complaint is about the floor in our room on the 5th floor. I don;t want to generalize this because I don't know how it is in the other rooms and floors. Our floor seems to be somewhat unstable because everytime we walk, the cabinet doors would shake and make noise. We were not bothered with the noise but were bothered by that fact that the cabinet doors would shake each time we walk. I would understand it if the floors were made of wood but I know that concrete floors are meant to be hard and stable and would not make a lose cabinet door shake if you walk around on it. Again in general, the hotel is good and if you're not bothered by those negative things that I mentioned, you will like Hotel Canova.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DonaCoArmagh
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four day trip to Rome. We stayed at the Hotel canova and found it to be a very pleasant experience. The hotel was small and informal. The bedrooms were well appointed and spotlessly clean. The breakfast was perfectly acceptable and included fruit juice,cereal, fresh coffee,crossiants etc. We enjoyed dining in the little breakfast room on the fifth floor, with its views of the surrounding area. The staff in the hotel were very courteous and helpful, adding to our enjoyment. This hotel has a great location, easy walking distance to the colosseum and several other historical sites. Five minutes from Cavour metro station, only one stop from Termini and the rest of Rome's major attractions. In all we had a fantastic trip and can't wait to return. We would stay at the Hotel Canova again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I think the three-star rating of Hotel Canova is misleading. My friends and I booked three rooms at Canova for our stay in Rome. One couple fled the hotel before our trip ended. Be prepared for very small rooms, some strange odors, odd stains, and lots of trips up and down the stairs. On the Saturday night of our stay, the next door disco came to life around midnight. That made sleeping fun. The breakfast sucks, so plan to go out. Best thing I can say about Canova is that its location is convenient, the staff seemed friendly and there is a great gelato stand around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: bayleygirl
Reviews.Content: Our room was very small, however, it was clean and we weren't in Rome to hang out in a hotel room. The bed & shower were fine. Breakfast was nothing extraordinary - cereals, pastries, yogurt, juice & coffee - but did the trick and started us off each morning. It is about a 15-20 minute walk from the Collosseum (check it out at night). This hotel does have a nice roof-top terrace - we bought a bottle of wine at the market down the street and relaxed each evening after a day of sight-seeing, before going out to dinner. I *highly* recommend Ristorante L'Esquilino right around the corner from the hotel at 87 Via Cavour. The food and service were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a safe, central position with easy access to all the major sights and only 10 mins walk to Termini and Colloseum.The road is quiet with only limited acccess for cars, and within 5 mins are several good restaurants and bars. Staff helpful, rooms compact but with super air-con., breakfast was adequate. Overall excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at Hotel Canova”
Reviews.Author: kramretsrof
Reviews.Content: Having booked a room at this Hotel on the basis of favourable reviews elsewhere I nearly cancelled after reading the poor feedback on tripwatch. I'm glad that I didn't as I have just returned from a very enjoyable stay. The hotel is exactly as it states on its website. It is well located so that all the main 'sights' are in easy walking distance and provides comfortable and clean accommodation. There is a variety of reasonably priced restaurants nearby and is handily placed for the terminii(10 minutes easy walk with a suitcase). The rooms are compact but as we hardly spent anytime there it didn't bother us.It had everything we needed after a long days sightseeing:- comfortable bed and a great shower.

Reviews.Title: “A place to avoid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A true disappointment. Despite arriving at 5:00 pm our room was not ready. After a wait in the lobby, we found our room to be incredibly small (even for European standards) with a strong, unpleasant odor. Even worse, the bed spread had NUMEROUS stains on it - of various colors and hues. The shower failed to drain properly and failed to have hot water one morning. Moreover, despite having a double room - the hotel only had one key to the room -- which created significant problems. As in many European hotels, you must have the key in the room to use the lights/television -- as a result, when one of us decided to go out at night while the other remained in the room, we were forced to choose between the person remaining not having any lights -- or relying on the frontdesk person to dig out a master key to let us back into the room. We were lucky, as the master key worked in our door lock, however the staff person noted they didn't have master keys for all rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had booked out reservation online and had a confirmation received by the hotel confirming our 3 night stay with the hotel. When we got there they had no record of our reservation. We showed them the e-mail and reservation number we received from their hotel - but they would not honor the reservation. They said that they did have rooms available but they would have to charge us more than what our original reservation said. They were completely rude about the entire situation and actually went as far as to blame us for not having the reservation confirmed. I would not recommend staying in this hotel. I would not give my money to anyone that would act that unprofessional and blame the customer for a mistake they clearly made.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked a room on the internet with hotelsinrome.com. Our reservation never made it to their system (this could be the internet site's problem). The staff were extremely rude and unwilling to help us, even though we had our e-mail confirmation showing we had a room. They should not post the hotel on the internet if they do not understand the customer does not have to contact the hotel after they make a reservation...that's the website's job. A confirmation e-mail should provide a room. They were going to offer us a smaller room for almost twice as much money. We left and stayed at Hotel Diplomatic for three nights. It was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Boddy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Canova for five nights in June 2004. Just a short walk from Termini, we found the hotel to be within easy access of most main attractions. Foyer was clean and typical of most small Rome hotels - marble floor and small reception/seating area. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Room was small but clean and contained everything you would need for a short stay in Rome. The hotel is nicely situated in a side street and is extremely quiet at night - a bonus for Rome. Definitely recommend for those on a budget.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Canova
